intro: Impatiens dorjeekhandui, commonly known as the Dorjeekhandui touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that release seeds upon touch. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
